metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19963 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in wolfSSL before 4.3.0 in a non-defaultconfiguration where DSA is enabled. DSA signing uses the BEEA algorithmduring modular inversion of the nonce, leading to a side-channel attackagainst the nonce.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19963` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl24 - 4.3.0+dfsg-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.0+dfsg-2').
